page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The character of lower Teesdale has changed drastically over this century.The early years saw a labour intensive agriculture with farmers, farm labourers, blacksmiths and allied workers occupying the farm houses and cottages of the area. Mechanisation of farming means the labour required today is perhaps one third what it was. Consequently many of the houses are no longer required for their original purpose. Some have fallen into disrepair and are abandoned, others have been sold or let. Their new occupants are either retired having chosen rural peace for their last years or they commute to work as accountants, dentists, museum curators, local government workers, teachers in Barnard Castle, Richmond, Bishop Auckland and Darlington.
